definition: to rub lightly/to move slowly/to dawdle/to dillydally/to pester/to nag
to rub/to grind/to polish/to sharpen/to wear down/to die out/to waste time/to pester/to insist
to rub against/to walk slowly/(coll.) to freeload

sentences.english: It can be irritating to your skin when your sweaty pubic hair rubs against hers.
sentences.chinese: 如果你汗湿的阴毛对着她磨蹭，可能刺激到你的皮肤。

sentences.english: He has been pissing around with the task for more than one week.
sentences.chinese: 他磨磨蹭蹭地做那项工作已经1个多星期了。

sentences.english: For a month the governer had dilly- dallied over the choice of a succe or.
sentences.chinese: 州长对于选择继任者磨磨蹭蹭了一个月。

sentences.english: Come now, daughter, don’t lag. Your mother will be hunting for us.
sentences.chinese: 走吧，女儿，别磨蹭了，你妈会到处找咱们的。

sentences.english: I traipsed all the way to the post office, only to find it was shut.
sentences.chinese: 我一路磨蹭到邮局，结果却发现邮局已经关门了。

sentences.english: If you are a procrastinator, stop procrastinating and start taking action right now.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是个磨蹭的人，停止拖沓并且现在就采取行动。

sentences.english: He takes a moment to rub a finger across it a few more times.
sentences.chinese: 他花了点时间，用手指在螺钉上再磨蹭了几次。

sentences.english: Don't drag your feet on this deadline.
sentences.chinese: 你不要在这最后期限的紧急关头磨磨蹭蹭。

sentences.english: Benjamin felt a nose nuzzling at his shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 本杰明感觉到有一个鼻子在他肩上磨蹭。

sentences.english: I dressed, dawdling, and hoped she would say something.
sentences.chinese: 我穿着衣服，磨蹭着时间，希望她会说点什么。

sentences.english: His back itched, so he leaned against the fence and rubbed against the boards.
sentences.chinese: 他的背开始发痒，所以他就靠着栅栏，在板条上磨蹭。

sentences.english: Don't dally over your meal, we don't want to miss our train.
sentences.chinese: 你吃饭别再磨蹭啦，我们不想误火车。

sentences.english: If you dillydally about any longer,we shall miss our plane.
sentences.chinese: 如果你再磨磨蹭蹭的话，我们要误飞机了。

sentences.english: The little girl pesters her mother for a new skirt.
sentences.chinese: 小姑娘跟妈妈磨蹭着要一条新裙子。

sentences.english: There are costs to all this dilly-dallying.
sentences.chinese: 一味磨磨蹭蹭是要付出代价的。

sentences.english: The eurozone has fiddled until Rome itself started to burn.
sentences.chinese: 欧元区一直在磨磨蹭蹭，直到罗马着火。

definition: to drag along/to haul/(fig.) to procrastinate/shilly-shallying/sluggish/(computing) drag and drop/(loanword) tola, unit of weight, approx. 11.664 grams
to do sth more quickly/Hurry up!/Get a move on!
erhua variant of 快點|快点[kuai4 dian3]
to swing/to sway/to wobble/to hang around/to hover around
incorrect variant of 囉嗦|啰嗦[luo1 suo5]
